<!-- THIS FILE IS AUTOMATICALLY GENERATED FROM THE `build.rs` FILE AT THE ROOT OF THIS PROJECT. DO NOT EDIT THIS BY HAND! -->
## `rover config auth`

```
rover-config-auth 0.0.2
Authenticate a configuration profile with an API key

Running this command with a --profile <name> argument will create a new profile that can be referenced by name across
Rover with the --profile <name> argument.

Running without the --profile flag will set an API key for a profile named "default".

See https://go.apollo.dev/r/api-keys for more details on Apollo's API keys.

USAGE:
    rover config auth [OPTIONS]

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       
            Prints help information

    -V, --version    
            Prints version information


OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>           
             [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]

        --profile <profile-name>    
             [default: default]

```

## `rover config clear`

```
rover-config-clear 0.0.2
Clear ALL configuration

WARNING: This command will delete ALL configuration profiles, not just one.

USAGE:
    rover config clear [OPTIONS]

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       
            Prints help information

    -V, --version    
            Prints version information


OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>    
             [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]

```

## `rover config delete`

```
rover-config-delete 0.0.2
Delete a configuration profile

Pass a name argument to choose which profile to delete. Not passing a profile name will delete the `default` profile

WARNING: Deleting the `default` profile will result in errors when running commands without specifying a `--profile`.

USAGE:
    rover config delete [OPTIONS] <name>

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       
            Prints help information

    -V, --version    
            Prints version information


OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>    
             [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]


ARGS:
    <name>    
            

```

## `rover config list`

```
rover-config-list 0.0.2
List all configuration profiles

USAGE:
    rover config list [OPTIONS]

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>     [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
```

## `rover config show`

```
rover-config-show 0.0.2
View a configuration profile's details

If a profile has sensitive info, like an API key, pass --sensitive to see it.

USAGE:
    rover config show [FLAGS] [OPTIONS] [name]

FLAGS:
    -h, --help         
            Prints help information

        --sensitive    
            

    -V, --version      
            Prints version information


OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>    
             [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]


ARGS:
    <name>    
             [default: default]

```

## `rover config whoami`

```
rover-config-whoami 0.0.2
View the identity of a user/api key

USAGE:
    rover config whoami [OPTIONS]

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>            [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
        --profile <profile-name>    Name of configuration profile to use [default: default]
```

## `rover graph check`

```
rover-graph-check 0.0.2
Check for breaking changes in a local graph schema against a graph schema in the Apollo graph registry

USAGE:
    rover graph check [OPTIONS] <GRAPH_REF> --schema <schema>

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>                                             [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
        --profile <profile-name>
            Name of configuration profile to use [default: default]

        --query-count-threshold <query-count-threshold>
            The minimum number of times a query or mutation must have been executed in order to be considered in the
            check operation
        --query-percentage-threshold <query-percentage-threshold>
            Minimum percentage of times a query or mutation must have been executed in the time window, relative to
            total request count, for it to be considered in the check. Valid numbers are in the range 0 <= x <= 100
    -s, --schema <schema>
            The schema file to push Can pass `-` to use stdin instead of a file

        --validation-period <validation-period>
            Size of the time window with which to validate schema against (i.e "24h" or "1w 2d 5h")


ARGS:
    <GRAPH_REF>    <NAME>@<VARIANT> of graph in Apollo Studio to validate. @<VARIANT> may be left off, defaulting to
                   @current
```

## `rover graph fetch`

```
rover-graph-fetch 0.0.2
Fetch a graph schema from the Apollo graph registry

USAGE:
    rover graph fetch [OPTIONS] <GRAPH_REF>

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>            [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
        --profile <profile-name>    Name of configuration profile to use [default: default]

ARGS:
    <GRAPH_REF>    <NAME>@<VARIANT> of graph in Apollo Studio to fetch from. @<VARIANT> may be left off, defaulting
                   to @current
```

## `rover graph push`

```
rover-graph-push 0.0.2
Push an updated graph schema to the Apollo graph registry

USAGE:
    rover graph push [OPTIONS] <GRAPH_REF> --schema <schema>

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>            [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
        --profile <profile-name>    Name of configuration profile to use [default: default]
    -s, --schema <schema>           The schema file to push Can pass `-` to use stdin instead of a file

ARGS:
    <GRAPH_REF>    <NAME>@<VARIANT> of graph in Apollo Studio to push to. @<VARIANT> may be left off, defaulting to
                   @current
```

## `rover subgraph check`

```
rover-subgraph-check 0.0.2
Check for composition errors and breaking changes caused by an updated subgraph schema against the federated graph in
the Apollo graph registry

USAGE:
    rover subgraph check [OPTIONS] <GRAPH_REF> --schema <schema> --name <subgraph>

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>                                             [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
        --profile <profile-name>
            Name of configuration profile to use [default: default]

        --query-count-threshold <query-count-threshold>
            The minimum number of times a query or mutation must have been executed in order to be considered in the
            check operation
        --query-percentage-threshold <query-percentage-threshold>
            Minimum percentage of times a query or mutation must have been executed in the time window, relative to
            total request count, for it to be considered in the check. Valid numbers are in the range 0 <= x <= 100
    -s, --schema <schema>
            The schema file to push Can pass `-` to use stdin instead of a file

        --name <subgraph>                                            Name of the subgraph to validate
        --validation-period <validation-period>
            Size of the time window with which to validate schema against (i.e "24h" or "1w 2d 5h")


ARGS:
    <GRAPH_REF>    <NAME>@<VARIANT> of graph in Apollo Studio to validate. @<VARIANT> may be left off, defaulting to
                   @current
```

## `rover subgraph delete`

```
rover-subgraph-delete 0.0.2
Delete a subgraph from the Apollo registry and trigger composition in the graph router

USAGE:
    rover subgraph delete [FLAGS] [OPTIONS] <GRAPH_REF> --name <subgraph>

FLAGS:
        --confirm    Skips the step where the command asks for user confirmation before deleting the subgraph. Also
                     skips preview of composition errors that might occur
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>            [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
        --profile <profile-name>    Name of configuration profile to use [default: default]
        --name <subgraph>           Name of subgraph in federated graph to delete

ARGS:
    <GRAPH_REF>    <NAME>@<VARIANT> of federated graph in Apollo Studio to delete subgraph from. @<VARIANT> may be
                   left off, defaulting to @current
```

## `rover subgraph fetch`

```
rover-subgraph-fetch 0.0.2
Fetch a subgraph schema from the Apollo graph registry

USAGE:
    rover subgraph fetch [OPTIONS] <GRAPH_REF> --name <subgraph>

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>            [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
        --profile <profile-name>    Name of configuration profile to use [default: default]
        --name <subgraph>           Name of subgraph in federated graph to update

ARGS:
    <GRAPH_REF>    <NAME>@<VARIANT> of graph in Apollo Studio to fetch from. @<VARIANT> may be left off, defaulting
                   to @current
```

```
rover-subgraph-list 0.0.2
List all subgraphs for a federated graph

USAGE:
    rover subgraph list [OPTIONS] <GRAPH_REF>

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>            [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
        --profile <profile-name>    Name of configuration profile to use [default: default]

ARGS:
    <GRAPH_REF>    <NAME>@<VARIANT> of graph in Apollo Studio to list subgraphs from. @<VARIANT> may be left off,
                   defaulting to @current
```

## `rover subgraph push`

```
rover-subgraph-push 0.0.2
Push an updated subgraph schema to the Apollo graph registry and trigger composition in the graph router

USAGE:
    rover subgraph push [OPTIONS] <GRAPH_REF> --routing-url <routing-url> --schema <schema> --name <subgraph>

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
    -l, --log <log-level>               [possible values: error, warn, info, debug, trace]
        --profile <profile-name>       Name of configuration profile to use [default: default]
        --routing-url <routing-url>    Url of a running subgraph that a gateway can route operations to (often a
                                       deployed subgraph). May be left empty ("") or a placeholder url if not running a
                                       gateway in managed federation mode
    -s, --schema <schema>              The schema file to push Can pass `-` to use stdin instead of a file
        --name <subgraph>              Name of subgraph in federated graph to update

ARGS:
    <GRAPH_REF>    <NAME>@<VARIANT> of federated graph in Apollo Studio to push to. @<VARIANT> may be left off,
                   defaulting to @current
```
